subject: Verify Your Account
body:
Dear {name},
We detected unusual activity in your account. Please verify immediately at [url=https://secure-bank.com/login]this link[/url].
tip: Banks usually address you by full name. Check the link carefully.

subject: Password Expiration Notice
body:
Dear Customer,
Your password will expire in 24 hours. Reset it at [url=https://secure-reset.company.com]this portal[/url].
tip: Generic greetings + urgent requests are often phishing.

subject: You Won a Gift Card!
body:
Dear {name},
Congratulations! Claim your $100 gift card here: [url=https://giftshop-prize.com]Claim Prize[/url].
tip: Unexpected prizes are usually scams.

subject: Account Alert
body:
Dear Customer,
A login attempt was made from a new device. If not you, secure your account.
tip: Legitimate banks use full names and official apps/sites.

subject: Suspicious Activity Detected
body:
Dear {name},
Your PayPal account has been locked. Confirm identity via your account page.
tip: Phishing often asks you to click a link or login unexpectedly.

subject: Final Warning: Account Closure
body:
Dear Customer,
Your account will be closed in 24 hours unless you log in.
tip: Urgency + generic greeting = suspicious.

subject: Urgent: Account Lock
body:
Dear Customer,
Your corporate account has been locked. Reset your password immediately.
tip: Corporate IT rarely sends generic emails asking for passwords.

subject: Disaster Relief Donations Needed
body:
Dear {name},
Donate now to help victims.
tip: Verify charities before donating; scammers use emotional triggers.

subject: Payment Issue
body:
Dear Customer,
We couldn't process your subscription payment. Update details.
tip: Streaming services usually let you update payments in their official app or site.

subject: Apple ID Locked
body:
Dear Customer,
Your Apple ID is locked. Restore access immediately.
tip: Check the sender domain; Apple always uses apple.com.

subject: Outstanding Payment Notice
body:
Dear Customer,
Your electricity bill is overdue. Pay immediately.
tip: Utility companies rarely send threats by email.

subject: Credit Card Fraud Alert
body:
Dear {name},
Suspicious transactions detected. Verify immediately.
tip: Banks usually notify via apps, not external links.

subject: Warranty Expired
body:
Dear Customer,
Your device warranty expired. Renew now.
tip: Unexpected expiration notices with external links are suspicious.

subject: Unusual Login Attempt
body:
Dear Customer,
Login attempt from unknown device. Secure your account.
tip: Generic greeting + unusual activity = red flag.

subject: Confirm Your Identity
body:
Dear Customer,
We need to confirm your identity. Click the link [url=https://banksecurity.com/security]HERE[/url]..
tip: Banks do not ask for personal info through emails.

subject: Parent-Teacher Meeting Reminder
body:
Dear {name},
Reminder for the scheduled parent-teacher meeting.
tip: Official school emails use correct domains.

subject: Monthly Reading List
body:
Dear {name},
Check out our recommended books for this month.
tip: Newsletters from official domains are safe.

subject: Your Purchase Receipt
body:
Dear {name},
Thank you for your purchase. Your receipt is attached.
tip: Legitimate receipts come from known stores.

subject: Updated Employee Handbook
body:
Dear {name},
Please review the updated handbook in the internal portal.
tip: Internal emails on secure domains are safe.

subject: Order Confirmation
body:
Dear Customer,
Thank you for your order! Track your package here.
tip: Legitimate order emails match your recent purchases.

subject: Booking Confirmation
body:
Dear {name},
Your flight booking is confirmed. View details in your account.
tip: Official airline emails use correct domains.

subject: Subscription Renewal
body:
Dear {name},
Your subscription will renew automatically. No action needed.
tip: Legitimate service emails clearly explain renewal policies.

subject: Weekly Workout Summary
body:
Dear {name},
Here is your weekly workout summary.
tip: Official app emails are safe if from the correct domain.

subject: Conference Registration Open
body:
Dear {name},
Registration for the Annual Tech Conference is open.
tip: Official events use correct domains.

subject: Invoice for Your Recent Purchase
body:
Dear {name},
Your purchase invoice is ready. Download it from your account.
tip: Legitimate invoices come from your account page.

subject: Monthly Statement
body:
Dear {name},
Your bank statement is ready. View it securely in your account.
tip: Official statements are accessible via bank portals.

subject: Upcoming Exhibit Announcement
body:
Dear {name},
Join us for our new exhibit starting next week.
tip: Newsletters from official domains are safe.

subject: Exam Schedule Released
body:
Dear {name},
The exam schedule is now available on the student portal.
tip: Official school communications are safe.

subject: Statement Available
body:
Dear Customer,
Your monthly statement is ready to view in your account.
tip: Official banks always use their proper domain and portal links.
